etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Jacob Bigelow (1786–1879). From scientific Latin Gillenia, genus name from Gillenius, Latinized form of the name of Arnold Gille, a 17th-cent. German botanist and physician + -a

definitions: Either of two erect herbaceous perennial plants comprising the genus Gillenia (family Rosaceae), native to eastern North America and frequently cultivated as garden plants, having toothed, palmate leaves and pale pink or white flowers.
